{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is presenting with clear vaginal discharge, positive Nitrazine test, and uterine contractions, which are consistent with preterm premature rupture of membranes (PROM). The next step in management is to administer betamethasone to promote fetal lung maturity and ampicillin to prevent infection. Induction of labor is not indicated at this time as the patient is only 32 weeks gestation. Cesarean section is not indicated as there are no signs of fetal distress. Therefore, the most appropriate next step is to administer betamethasone, ampicillin, and proceed with expectant management.", "answer_choice": "D"}
